questions.question: I really .................................... when I was on holiday.
questions.description: Enjoyed is a transitive verb and requires an object. If there is no object, we use a reflexive pronoun as the object.

questions.question: He hurt .................................. while playing football.
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: They praised .......................................
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: He patted ...................................... on the back.
questions.description: We use reflexive pronouns when the object refers to the same person as the subject.

questions.question: She was beside ......................................... with sorrow.
questions.description: A reflexive pronoun can be used after a preposition.

questions.question: He did it all by ....................................
questions.description: We use a reflexive pronoun after a preposition.

questions.question: No one loves me better than ................................. do.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used only when the subject and the object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: Rani and ................................. went shopping yesterday.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is not used as the subject of the verb.
